NATIONAL NEWS






Vote on Texas power market limits postponed: TXU deal is still on, investors say, despite move to limit firms' generation capacity



Apr. 26--AUSTIN -- As politics delayed a House vote on legislation meant to force the state's largest power generation companies to shrink, the investors that wish to buy TXU Corp. said they still expect their deal to close.  The House was scheduled to vote on a bill Wednesday that would limit the amount of power generation capacity each company may own. The bill's sponsor, Rep.


Apr 26, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



EPA proposal adds air pollution, environmentalists say: How output from coal-fired plants measured at issue



Apr. 27--Environmentalists who sued Duke Energy Corp. over upgrades at its coal-fired plants say a proposed EPA rule undermines their U.S. Supreme Court victory and would give utilities a free hand to pollute.  At issue is how the government measures air pollution from the smokestacks of coal-fired power plants and other sources. Environmentalists say the pollution should be counted as tons per ...

Westar Energy CEO announces retirement



Apr. 26--Jim Haines, a rural Lawrence resident who helped lead Westar Energy Inc. out of debt, is retiring in June as the utility's chief executive officer, the company announced Wednesday.  Haines will be replaced by William Moore, Westar's president and chief operating officer, who has worked at the company during all but two of the past 29 years. "We are confident that the company will ...


Apr 26, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Paying to save energy: LIPA considers investing $924 million to reduce LI's power usage, but ratepayers could see an increase on their bills as a result



Apr. 26--The Long Island Power Authority wants to conserve energy -- but it's going to cost you.  Months into planning and still under development, a new LIPA program called Efficiency Long Island initially set a target of eliminating 500 megawatts of energy use from the system by 2018. That goal is something environmentalists and, more recently, Gov. Eliot Spitzer said is a necessary first step ...


Apr 26, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



WPL not happy with wind decision



Apr. 26--Wisconsin Power & Light says it still plans to build its first wind farm in Wisconsin, but it may not do so under the terms first proposed to the state Public Service Commission.  WPL wants to build the Cedar Ridge Wind Farm in Fond du Lac County. That's a 40-turbine project with an estimated cost of $180 million that could generate up to 99 megawatts of electricity.

Hedlund, Republican of Weymouth, said in an interview yesterday that he has received the commitments of enough members of the Senate to effectively block the terminal. Hedlund said that AES Corp., the Virginia-based ...

Westar CEO to step down: In troubled times, he helped return the company to its roots as an electric utility. William Moore is named to succeed him.



Apr. 26--James Haines, who helped Westar Energy out of its struggles with unregulated businesses and back to its electric-utility roots, has decided to retire from the Topeka company.  Haines will retire as chief executive officer and a director of Westar on June 30. Westar's board on Wednesday announced that William Moore, president and chief operating office at Westar, would succeed Haines. ...

Windmill's excess energy will power others in North Carolina



Apr. 26--Your electricity could be coming from the wind.  And not just any wind. These breezes are blowing right off the northern end of Cape Hatteras National Seashore and twirling a rather unassuming 70-foot-high wind turbine. For two years it has powered the Coquina Beach bathhouse. Now it has the potential to power places farther away. Dominion North Carolina Power has installed a second ...

LIPA confirmed yesterday that it delayed the vote, scheduled for today, by its trustees on the National Grid contracts -- reached in principle ...

Avista Files for Electric and Natural Gas Rate Adjustments in Washington



SPOKANE, Wash., April 26 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- Avista (NYSE: AVA) today filed a request with the Washington Utilities and Transportation Commission (WUTC) to increase rates by an average 15.85 percent for electric customers and 2.27 percent for natural gas customers in Washington. Valero Board Approves Election of Eric Fisher to Corporate Officer



SAN ANTONIO--(BUSINESS WIRE)--The Valero Energy Corporation (NYSE:VLO) Board of Directors has approved the election of Eric Fisher, currently Valeros Vice President of Investor Relations, to the position of Corporate Vice President-Investor and Corporate Communications. Fisher will report directly to Valero Chairman and CEO Bill Klesse. The promotion became effective upon the boards approval ...

MichCon Announces Jamestown Pipeline Plan



Michigan Consolidated Gas Co. (MichCon) today announced a two-year project to install a new natural gas pipeline in West Michigan that will increase gas supplies and help meet future market demand spurred by residential and business growth.     Construction of the 16.3-mile Jamestown Pipeline will begin in June and be completed in the 2008 construction season.

The new turbine will eventually replace an older, less-efficient machine. This project represents an investment of approximately US$130 million and is part of the ...

ExxonMobil Chemical Boosts Capacity to Produce Spectrasyn Ultra(TM) High VI Polyalphaolefins



Spectrasyn Ultra High VI Polyalphaolefins HOUSTON--(BUSINESS WIRE)--ExxonMobil Chemical (NYSE:XOM) today announced the completion of a debottleneck project at the Beaumont Synthetics plant that increases by 40 percent the capacity to produce SpectraSyn Ultra High VI high viscosity polyalphaolefins (PAO). Ontario plans to bring dozens of clean-energy megawatts online by 2010



TORONTO (CP) - with the construction of North America's largest solar farm and 13 other renewable energy projects. Energy Minister Dwight Duncan says the solar farm in Sarnia, Ont., will be built by OptiSolar Farms and consist of over one million ground-mounted solar panels. The company will produce 40 megawatts of energy starting in 2010, enough to power about 6,000 homes.

EPA proposes controversial energy rule



WASHINGTON - The government proposed a pollution standard for power plants Wednesday that critics said flouts the spirit of a Supreme Court ruling on clean air enforcement.The proposal would make it easier for utilities to expand plant operations or make other changes to produce more electricity without installing new pollution controls.Critics said the Environmental Protection Agency was ...

ETT Partners With The Wind Coalition To Analyze New Transmission Needed To Support Texas Wind Generation



Austin, TX - Every dollar spent for construction of new transmission lines to support the development of wind resources in Texas will result in a $5 to $7 reduction in energy costs, according to testimony filed recently with the Public Utility Commission of Texas (PUCT) by Electric Transmission Texas LLC (ETT), a proposed joint venture between subsidiaries of American Electric Power and ...

The business roadmap charts the course for the ...

PSC Approves Plans To Further Strengthen The State's Electric Infrastructure



Tallahassee - The Florida Public Service Commission (PSC) recently approved a proposal by Florida Power & Light (FPL) intended to provide an incentive for local governments to move overhead power lines underground. FPL requested the change to its operating tariff in order to improve reliability of service and reduce vulnerability to storm damage. "The approved tariff provides local governments ...


Apr 26, 2007 Power Online



Valero reports record earnings for first quarter



Valero Energy Corp. earned the highest first-quarter profits in company history posting net income of $1.1 billion, or $1.86 per share, for the period ending March 31, 2007. That compares to net income of $849 million, or $1.32 per share, for the first quarter of 2006. First-quarter operating income was $1.8 billion, compared to $1.3 billion for the year-ago period.


Apr 26, 2007 San Antonio Business Journal



Aggreko shares power ahead after string of new deals



AGGREKO, the Glasgow-basd temporary power supply company, has predicted profits in 2007 will be well ahead of analysts' estimates, buoyed by a strong first quarter and a string of new contracts. Shares in the firm, which helped restore power after Hurricane Katrina ravaged the southern US in 2005, surged by 8.9 per cent - or 45.5p - to a record high of 559p on the news.
